column4: ok, now modprobe ndiswrapper works. but the wlan0 does not exist
now it does :) but now to the problem I had earlier, no stations are found while scanning. Don't have a cleu to fix that
what wifi card do you have?
I've set the correct channel, but iwlist wlan0 scan does not return any results
a belkin f5d700yy with broadcom chipset
followed the how-to thread on the ubuntuforums with no luck
ndiswrapper -l tells me that the drivers are installed and that the hardware is present
but I can't move on from here
run iwconfig, does your card show up at all?
yeah
as what?
wlan0
no invalid nwid, crypt or flags
Link quality: 100/100, Signal level: -10dBM, Noise leel: -256dB;, but no AP mac
Mode managed, Frequency 2.437 (chan 6), which is correct. Don't now why it don't find the ap.
bring up wlan0 with 'ifconfig wlan0 up' and see if that helps
nope no luck
I get this error in the log though, might be a problem? -> wlan0: no IPv6 routers prese
nt
well, im out of ideas already, but i have never used ndiswrapper
ok :/
